title: Custom Installation Path for Bash on Ubuntu on Windows
body: Currently, when installing Windows Subsystem for Linux / Bash on Ubuntu on Windows, you do not have a choice of where to install the system. The image alone is ~700 MB before using apt-get or installing any pre-packaged software from the repositories. Adding an option to move or install to a location other than "C:\Users\[UserName]\AppData\Local\lxss" would be greatly beneficial; especially for those of us who manage our SSD / OS partition sizes carefully and using symbolic links can get messy.
